abstract.p: Merck & Co names DDB Needham New York to handle advertising for its new prescription pain reliever Vioxx; ESC Medical Systems Ltd, maker of laser-technology products, names Warwick Baker O'Neill to handle new consumer account (S)

block.p: A drug manufacturer and a maker of laser-technology products have selected agencies for new assignments.

Merck & Company selected DDB Needham New York to handle advertising for Vioxx, its entry into a new category of prescription pain relievers intended to treat arthritis and acute pain. Billings were estimated at $30 million.
A drug manufacturer and a maker of laser-technology products have selected agencies for new assignments.

Merck & Company selected DDB Needham New York to handle advertising for Vioxx, its entry into a new category of prescription pain relievers intended to treat arthritis and acute pain. Billings were estimated at $30 million.

Rebecca Higbee, a spokeswoman for Merck in West Point, Pa., said DDB Needham New York, part of Omnicom Group, was awarded the assignment after a five-month review among four shops that have not been Merck roster agencies. She identified the others, all in New York, as: Grey Advertising; Messner Vetere Berger McNamee Schmetterer Euro RSCG, part of Havas Advertising, and Warwick Baker O'Neill.

Warwick Baker was named by a second advertiser, ESC Medical Systems Ltd. in Needham, Mass., to handle a new consumer account with estimated first-year billings of $12 million. ESC, which makes and markets laser technology devices like the Epilight hair remover, selected Warwick Baker after a two-month review that had been narrowed to that agency and three others: Gotham Inc. in New York, a unit of the Interpublic Group of Companies; Publicis in New York, part of Publicis S. A., and Quantum Group in Parsippany, N.J.,
Both reviews were managed by Advice and Advisors in New York.
